Package nl.naturalis.yokete.view

Interface Accessor<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of objects that can be accessed by this Accessor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    KeyValueAccessor
    public interface Accessor<T>
    A generic interface for objects that mediate between the data layer and view layer. Its purpose is to provide name-based access to the data in your model beans (or whatever it is the data layer serves up). More precisely, its purpose is to map template variables to bean properties. In the simplest case there is a one-to-one correspondenc between variable names and bean properties, but this need not necessarily be so.

    You can write your own ViewData implementations or use one of three implementations in the nl.naturalis.yokete.view.data package.

    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

      Object getValue​(T from, String varName)
      Returns the value of the specified template variable.

    • Field Detail

      • ABSENT

        static final Object ABSENT

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        Object getValue​(T from,
                String varName)
         throws RenderException
        Returns the value of the specified template variable. Implementations must distinguish between true null values and the variable not being present in the source data at all. True null values are valid valid values that will be stringified somehow by a Stringifier (e.g. to an empty string or to "&nbsp;"). If the variable could not be mapped to a bean property at all, this method must return the special value ABSENT. If a RenderSession receives this value for a particular variable, it will assume you don't want to that particular variable just yet. (In the end, of course, all template variables must be set before the template can be rendered.)
        Parameters:
        from - The object (supposedly) containing the value
        varName - The name of the template variable
        Returns:
        The value of the variable
        Throws:
        RenderException
